choices.C: The local gateway IP must an IPv4 address.
choices.B: The source quick mode selector must be an IPv4 address.
choices.D: The destination quick mode selector must be an IPv6 address.
choices.A: The remote gateway IP must be an IPv6 address.

questions.question_text: Which statements about an IPv6-over-IPv4 IPsec configuration are correct? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Execute the CLI command execute formatlogdisk.
choices.D: Select the format boot device option from the BIOS menu.

questions.question_text: How can you format the FortiGate flash disk?
How do you configure a FortiGate to do traffic shaping of P2P traffic, such as BitTorrent?

choices.D: Apply a traffic shaper to a protocol options profile.
choices.B: Enable the shape option in a firewall policy with service set to BitTorrent.
choices.C: Apply a traffic shaper to a BitTorrent entry in the SSL/SSH inspection profile.
choices.A: Apply an application control profile allowing BitTorrent to a firewall policy and configure a traffic shaping policy.

questions.question_text: Which component of FortiOS performs application control inspection?

choices.C: Synthesizes DNS AAAA records from A records.
choices.D: Translates the destination IPv4 address of the DNS traffic to an IPv6 address.
choices.B: Translates the destination IPv6 address of the DNS traffic to an IPv4 address.
choices.A: Converts DNS A record lookups to AAAA record lookups.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
DNS64 is a DNS service that returns AAAA records with these synthetic IPv6 addresses for IPv4-only destinations
https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/dns64

questions.question_text: What statement describes what DNS64 does?
